001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.util.ErrorMessages.requireNonNullParam;
008
009import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.HolonomicDriveController;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.PIDController;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.ProfiledPIDController;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Rotation2d;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.SwerveDriveKinematics;
015import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.SwerveModuleState;
016import edu.wpi.first.math.trajectory.Trajectory;
017import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Timer;
018import java.util.function.Consumer;
019import java.util.function.Supplier;
020
021/**
022 * A command that uses two PID controllers ({@link PIDController}) and a ProfiledPIDController
023 * ({@link ProfiledPIDController}) to follow a trajectory {@link Trajectory} with a swerve drive.
024 *
025 * <p>This command outputs the raw desired Swerve Module States ({@link SwerveModuleState}) in an
026 * array. The desired wheel and module rotation velocities should be taken from those and used in
027 * velocity PIDs.
028 *
029 * <p>The robot angle controller does not follow the angle given by the trajectory but rather goes
030 * to the angle given in the final state of the trajectory.
031 *
032 * <p>This class is provided by the NewCommands VendorDep
033 */
034@SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
035public class SwerveControllerCommand extends CommandBase {
036  private final Timer m_timer = new Timer();
037  private final Trajectory m_trajectory;
038  private final Supplier<Pose2d> m_pose;
039  private final SwerveDriveKinematics m_kinematics;
040  private final HolonomicDriveController m_controller;
041  private final Consumer<SwerveModuleState[]> m_outputModuleStates;
042  private final Supplier<Rotation2d> m_desiredRotation;
043
044  /**
045   * Constructs a new SwerveControllerCommand that when executed will follow the provided
046   * trajectory. This command will not return output voltages but rather raw module states from the
047   * position controllers which need to be put into a velocity PID.
048   *
049   * <p>Note: The controllers will *not* set the outputVolts to zero upon completion of the path-
050   * this is left to the user, since it is not appropriate for paths with nonstationary endstates.
051   *
052   * @param trajectory The trajectory to follow.
053   * @param pose A function that supplies the robot pose - use one of the odometry classes to
054   *     provide this.
055   * @param kinematics The kinematics for the robot drivetrain.
056   * @param xController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for the robot's x position.
057   * @param yController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for the robot's y position.
058   * @param thetaController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for angle for the robot.
059   * @param desiredRotation The angle that the drivetrain should be facing. This is sampled at each
060   *     time step.
061   * @param outputModuleStates The raw output module states from the position controllers.
062   * @param requirements The subsystems to require.
063   */
064  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
065  public SwerveControllerCommand(
066      Trajectory trajectory,
067      Supplier<Pose2d> pose,
068      SwerveDriveKinematics kinematics,
069      PIDController xController,
070      PIDController yController,
071      ProfiledPIDController thetaController,
072      Supplier<Rotation2d> desiredRotation,
073      Consumer<SwerveModuleState[]> outputModuleStates,
074      Subsystem... requirements) {
075    m_trajectory = requireNonNullParam(trajectory, "trajectory", "SwerveControllerCommand");
076    m_pose = requireNonNullParam(pose, "pose", "SwerveControllerCommand");
077    m_kinematics = requireNonNullParam(kinematics, "kinematics", "SwerveControllerCommand");
078
079    m_controller =
080        new HolonomicDriveController(
081            requireNonNullParam(xController, "xController", "SwerveControllerCommand"),
082            requireNonNullParam(yController, "xController", "SwerveControllerCommand"),
083            requireNonNullParam(thetaController, "thetaController", "SwerveControllerCommand"));
084
085    m_outputModuleStates =
086        requireNonNullParam(outputModuleStates, "frontLeftOutput", "SwerveControllerCommand");
087
088    m_desiredRotation =
089        requireNonNullParam(desiredRotation, "desiredRotation", "SwerveControllerCommand");
090
091    addRequirements(requirements);
092  }
093
094  /**
095   * Constructs a new SwerveControllerCommand that when executed will follow the provided
096   * trajectory. This command will not return output voltages but rather raw module states from the
097   * position controllers which need to be put into a velocity PID.
098   *
099   * <p>Note: The controllers will *not* set the outputVolts to zero upon completion of the path-
100   * this is left to the user, since it is not appropriate for paths with nonstationary endstates.
101   *
102   * <p>Note 2: The final rotation of the robot will be set to the rotation of the final pose in the
103   * trajectory. The robot will not follow the rotations from the poses at each timestep. If
104   * alternate rotation behavior is desired, the other constructor with a supplier for rotation
105   * should be used.
106   *
107   * @param trajectory The trajectory to follow.
108   * @param pose A function that supplies the robot pose - use one of the odometry classes to
109   *     provide this.
110   * @param kinematics The kinematics for the robot drivetrain.
111   * @param xController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for the robot's x position.
112   * @param yController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for the robot's y position.
113   * @param thetaController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for angle for the robot.
114   * @param outputModuleStates The raw output module states from the position controllers.
115   * @param requirements The subsystems to require.
116   */
117  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
118  public SwerveControllerCommand(
119      Trajectory trajectory,
120      Supplier<Pose2d> pose,
121      SwerveDriveKinematics kinematics,
122      PIDController xController,
123      PIDController yController,
124      ProfiledPIDController thetaController,
125      Consumer<SwerveModuleState[]> outputModuleStates,
126      Subsystem... requirements) {
127    this(
128        trajectory,
129        pose,
130        kinematics,
131        xController,
132        yController,
133        thetaController,
134        () ->
135            trajectory.getStates().get(trajectory.getStates().size() - 1).poseMeters.getRotation(),
136        outputModuleStates,
137        requirements);
138  }
139
140  @Override
141  public void initialize() {
142    m_timer.reset();
143    m_timer.start();
144  }
145
146  @Override
147  @SuppressWarnings("LocalVariableName")
148  public void execute() {
149    double curTime = m_timer.get();
150    var desiredState = m_trajectory.sample(curTime);
151
152    var targetChassisSpeeds =
153        m_controller.calculate(m_pose.get(), desiredState, m_desiredRotation.get());
154    var targetModuleStates = m_kinematics.toSwerveModuleStates(targetChassisSpeeds);
155
156    m_outputModuleStates.accept(targetModuleStates);
157  }
158
159  @Override
160  public void end(boolean interrupted) {
161    m_timer.stop();
162  }
163
164  @Override
165  public boolean isFinished() {
166    return m_timer.hasElapsed(m_trajectory.getTotalTimeSeconds());
167  }
168}
